abstracts.cdata!:
The Financial Sector Adjustment Credit
            Project, will support the Government's medium-term
            strategy for financial sector reform, in order to achieve
            macroeconomic stability, accelerate private sector growth,
            and reduce poverty. The components include the establishment
            of basic financial infrastructure, such as improved banking
            skills, accounting standards, and clear policy framework
            regarding bank failures; consolidation of the banking
            system; divestiture of the Government's ownership in
            the Trade and Development Bank; development of effective
            regulation, and supervision of the financial system;
            improvement of the payments system in rural areas; and,
            confirmation of the government's commitment to honor
            financial contracts, through a timely servicing of
            Government bonds. Within the strategic framework, the
            project will provide financial resources to Mongolia, and
            avoid excessive transitional decline in consumption, and
            investment practices, enabling a reasonable adjustment to
            recent trade shocks. The economy will benefit from the
            emergence of institutions, and markets, thus,
            inter-mediation of financial resources will be ensured.
            However, the outcome of the forthcoming parliamentary
            elections may hinder ownership of the financial sector
            program, and, the limitations within the administrative
            capacity, may be further weakened by the opposition of
            vested interests.
